items.content_html:
Description

Use GibiByte units instead of GigaByte units, in /files/en-us/web/javascript/reference/errors/invalid_array_length/index.md

Motivation

"BiBytes" are more accurate. Using "traditional" decimal units is misleading

Additional details

Wikipedia

Related issues and pull requests

  • I haven't found issues about this
  • I haven't found related PRs
items.title: GB -> GiB at .../invalid_array_length/index.md

items.content_html: Added details to the inert attribute.
items.title: Inert: more details

items.content_html:
Motivation

These updates were triggered by #21229 and realizing that our template does not indicate where to insert the "Description" section. In the process of adding that section to the template, I discovered some other sections that were missing.

Description

  1. This PR adds the following missing sections to the CSS property page template to indicate their position in a CSS property page:
  • "Constituent properties"
  • "Description"
  • Added a sentence about the interactive example to show its position on the page as well as the fact that the macro call inserts the section title

  1. This PR also makes some language improvements to maintain parallel structure and consistency.

  2. Some other changes:

  • From front matter's browser-compat description, I have moved the info about the {{Compat}} and {{Specifications}} macros to a section titled "Other macros in the page". This section will cover {{Compat}} and {{Specifications}} as well as {{CSSInfo}} and {{CSSSyntax}} macros.
  • Moved the code block to within the "Syntax" section.
  • Removed {{cssxref}} macro calls in subvalue descriptions so that they don't get displayed as unwritten pages.
  • In all the sections that call macros (Formal definition, Formal syntax, Specifications, and Compatibility), I've removed the actual macro call to avoid displaying an error on the published page. I've replaced it with an escaped string to call the macro and added a note to remove the escape character when actually using the macro.

Related issues and pull requests

Relates to #21229
items.title: Add missing sections to the CSS property page template

items.content_html: Just a few little fixes to the new MutationRecord pages.
items.title: MutationRecord: a little cleanup

items.content_html:
Description

Add combobox role to button element and input[type="button"].

Motivation

combobox role for button element and input[type="button"] was added to ARIA in HTML on January 15, 2022. Aligning MDN documentation to spec.

Additional details

Related docs for button and for input[type="button"].
items.title: Add `combobox` role to `button` and `input[type="button"]`

items.content_html:
Description

This PR updates the get* method pages on the main Performance interface.

  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance/getEntries
  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance/getEntriesByName
  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance/getEntriesByType

Motivation

openwebdocs/project#62

Additional details

I've provided a notebox to say that PerformanceObservers are the better way to retrieve performance entries.
I've simplified again the code examples a lot to not check for the method's support etc.

Related issues and pull requests

None.
items.title: Update Performance.get* method pages

items.content_html:
Description

Fix the condition of when NetworkError is thrown from SerialPort.getSignals().

Motivation

This method is for retrieving the status of signals and doesn't look setting signals, so "Returned if the signals on the device could not be set." looked weird.

Additional details

Specification: Web Serial API / 4.8 getSignals() method

If the operating system fails to determine the status of these signals for any reason, queue a global task on the relevant global object of this using the serial port task source to reject promise with a "NetworkError" DOMException and abort these steps.

This looks like about reading the signals, not setting ones.

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Fix SerialPort.getSignals()

items.content_html:
Description

This PR updates the Resource Timing related methods and events on the main Performance interface.

  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance/clearResourceTimings
  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance/setResourceTimingBufferSize
  • https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Performance/resourcetimingbufferfull_event

Motivation

openwebdocs/project#62

Additional details

I think very often code examples that check for support aren't very useful. It is a very meta thing to do that outdates quickly as the feature becomes available broadly. Imho it also distracts from showing how the feature in question behaves.

Related issues and pull requests

None.
items.title: Update Resource Timing Performance pages

items.content_html:
Description

The text on line 82 said that two inputs would have a custom style, while only one of them did actually differ from the rest. Instead of changing the code, I changed the text to reflect what's actually happening.

Motivation

To keep the text consistent with what's being shown.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Update index.md

items.content_html:
Description

This PR aims to do the work of migrating the existing Feature-Policy docs over toPermissions-Policy, as described in #22347

See my research document at https://docs.google.com/document/d/14xHANU3n43PfJR_dCpEwVCiVYv12BAfGqOICNvd79R4/edit#heading=h.mahbkxhoku5t for a list of the Permissions-Policy directives I am intending to implement on MDN as part of this work. This gives us parity with what was previously documented under Feature-Policy, but it adds a few more that are known to be supported, and it removes mention of some that were obviously being worked on at some point, but never seem to have gotten any traction.

Also see the equivalent BCD changes at mdn/browser-compat-data#18250

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Update Feature-Policy to Permissions-Policy

items.content_html:
Description

Renames almost standards mode and full standards mode to limited-quirks and no-quirks mode, in line with newer versions of the spec. Also removes mentions that quirks mode is nonstandard as it isn't.

Motivation

Using the old names (and implying that the behavior is not standardized) is misleading information since it's no longer the case. Updating the information would be more useful for future readers to understand what these modes are.

Additional details

See the note below this line on the DOM spec.
items.title: Rename render modes to use the new spec-defined names
